### 1724 Records

Beijing,China

Founded in June 2006, 1724 Records, which is located in Beijing, is a mini label focusing on spreading indie music.

The name 1724 roots in that truth: the feeling and inspiration in youth will affect the trajectory of your life. 1724 Records believes that music has the power to rebuild the shape of our soul. Based on this concept they have issued albums and eps for musicians such as 48V, Thumb Girls, oNEwAY, kayak, pentatonic, YiyuanLiang,Summer Fades Away,saisa,The Grinding Ear,Sparrow,Amber,Muggle,etc.

Now 1724 Records is concentrating on Post-rock and Folk music, including electronic, experimental, ambient and some other types. They are trying to bloom indie music and hope that more and more people can touch the feeling of youth through their music.

As a branch of the net media IndieChina(www.indiechina.com/), 1724 records is also engaged in artist management. Till now they have organized numbers of live shows and music festivals for their musicians .

### BBAM! Gallery

808 Atwater
Montreal, Quebec

If you are looking for quality pop art, vintage jazz vinyl, in addition to related pop culture items like books, cds, posters and of course, art - come down for a visit and enjoy a latte or capuccino while you browse our treasures. Rare CTI, Impulse, Verve, Blue Note in addition to strong selections in Blues, Rock, Soundtrack, Comedy, Country, Classical, Spoken Word, Reggae, Folk and of course, Quebec (and France). We also carry funky art cards, books, cds, DVDs and collector rock buttons.

Co - owner Ralph Alfonso is a music industry and Canadian pop culture veteran whose career has spanned punk rock (manager; The Diodes), major labels (Warner, Capitol-EMI, Nettwerk, Attic), indie label (Bongo Beat Records) beatnik poetry, fanzines (RALPH), photography and all points inbetween (his books and cds and photos are available here).

BBAM! Gallery is located up the street from Lionel Groulx Metro. Step out the station, turn left, walk towards the Esso gas station and we are halfway up. You can also walk down Atwater from the Atwater Metro stop (we are on the west side of Atwater).

Si vous êtes à la recherche pour le pop art de qualité, vieux vinyles jazz, et aussi des éléments de la culture pop comme des livres, des CD, des affiches et bien sûr, l'art - descendre pour une visite et profiter d'un café au lait ou capuccino pendant que vous naviguez nos trésors. CTI, Impulse, Verve, Blue Note et également de fortes sélections en Blues, Rock, bandes sonores de films, Humour, Country, Spoken Word, Reggae, Folk et bien sûr, le Québec (et la France). Nous avons aussi des cartes géniales d'art, des livres, des CD, des DVD et des boutons collecteur Rock.

Le propriétaire, Ralph Alfonso, est un vétéran de l'industrie  musique et une légende canadienne de la culture pop; sa carrière a duré punk rock (gerant; The Diodes), les grandes maisons de disques (Nettwerk, Attic, Warner, Capitol-EMI), et son label (Bongo Beat Records), la poésie beatnik, fanzines (RALPH), la photographie et beaucoup plus (ses livres et CDs et photos sont disponibles ici).

Galerie BBAM! est située au métro Lionel-Groulx. Sortez de la gare, tourner à gauche, marcher vers la station Esso.

![BBAM! Gallery](https://discogslabs.imgix.net/vinylhub/5b34f2d15f004900274b8385.jpg?auto=compress%2Cformat&fit=max&fm=jpg&h=2000&w=2000&s=8028c1d62e791fdb3305979a9e60d932 "BBAM! Gallery")

### Brass City Records & Old Tools

489 Meadow St. Waterbury CT 06702

I've been selling music for thirty one  years right here in the shop and 10 years before that at record shows up & down the east coast and Europe.... We have loads of vinyl and inexpensive cds. While the sixties are my specialty, we have quite a lot of punk, metal, new wave, jazz, fifties, folk and R n' B. There's a big bin of $1 records in the back room...and a large bin of FREE records as well...while we're on the subject of prices: Throw away your price guides because I don't use 'em. I think they're highly over rated and way over priced. I don't want to have a museum here and everything is  priced to sell. Some of my customers actually have made a comfortable living selling stuff on ebay that they bought here...that's all part of the circle and more power to them...they come back and buy more...everybody's happy...I've got listening stations set up for vinyl and cds so you're not buying a "pig in a poke". You buy these to listen to...not to look at; so I guarantee each and every item I put out. Sorry no "flavor of the week" stuff here; we're not a maul store and don't want to be..

This is the largest indie store in the state and it does take quite a bit of time to see everything there is to see. I really should re-locate to New York City or Boston, the stock is that good! But, here I am in Waterbury the back ass end of the universe.... So it goes...

I do buy large collections of vinyl...give me a call or drop me a line...

The Brass City Tool  Shop

 I sell records for a living but I have a passion for woodworking and old tools. I really enjoy sharing both with anyone who will listen, and sometimes even people who will not listen. I own the only record store I know of with a functioning, though small, woodworking bench. I offer some fine wood working tools, most over 75 years old, and some well over 100 years old. They all still do what they were intended to do. Most were made right here in Connecticut within a stones throw of where I sit. The tools that I sell are tools that I would be proud to have in my own shop, or that I do have in my collection.

 
I clean for use . Blades will be sharp and ready to use, but it's up to you to put the final touches on the bevel. Soles will be flat for use but not polished . Please send your requests for tools and parts. I've got so many I couldn't possibly list them all. I guarantee all the tools I sell 100%...money back guarantee, just like the old days. Payment by cash, check, money order, charge card or paypal.

I only buy tools that I would be proud to own. I look for good "bones" ie: solid castings, good wood, and functioning mechanicals. 

I also buy old woodworking tools, particularly pattern makers and jointer's tool chests. If you have had a family member who worked in this trade please contact me. I personally collect scraper planes and spokeshaves. 

Walt Q...brass@snet.net 203-574-7805 if you call, please give me a few moments to get to a phone...this place is pretty big...


Any and all galoots are always welcome at the shop...drop by and try out some of the tools. ..if you're traveling through Connecticut; I'm 2 blocks off I-84 exit 21 or route 8 exit 32. Call or e-mail for directions or slap the address into mapquest.

![Brass City Records & Old Tools](https://discogslabs.imgix.net/vinylhub/54ff4290a353150011d759a6.jpg?auto=compress%2Cformat&fit=max&fm=jpg&h=2000&w=2000&s=320f848b65ab36b524d99c476578581c "Brass City Records & Old Tools")

### Bump 'n Grind

1200 East West Highway, Silver Spring, Maryland 20910

Coffee and vinyl records. These are two of our favorite things. They each bring joy to our senses; taste, smell, auditory. Each has also seen technology deliver these pleasures to a faster, consumer driven world, whether it be a cup of coffee, our favorite espresso drink, or the sound of music. We believe that much like a record spinning on a platter and the slow drip of a pour over, coffee and music are both best enjoyed in their most analog forms. So we decided to combine the two and bring the South Silver Spring Community a coffee shop with a love and passion for great coffee, espresso, and vinyl records. Hand poured individual coffees from around the world are offered and rotate as harvesting seasons come and go. We've worked with Vigilante Coffee to create our own, signature espresso blend which can be found only at Bump'nGrind. We have highly curated and small selections of new release vinyl with a focus on dance music, jazz, funk, soul, dub, rock, hiphop, and everything in between. Two listening stations allow customers to get lost in music and refine their selections prior to purchase. We hope you will enjoy our laid back atmosphere and relax to free wireless internet and a community turntable stocked with a crate of records for every customer to dig into and find gems to play over the shop's sound system or personal headphones. Come see why, sometimes, the best things are enjoyed at a slower pace.

![Bump 'n Grind](https://discogslabs.imgix.net/vinylhub/5494843f103ba40010a58b65.jpg?auto=compress%2Cformat&fit=max&fm=jpg&h=2000&w=2000&s=2f401ef56f81da0bf801d10532300b49 "Bump 'n Grind")

### Shuga Records

1272 North Milwaukee Ave

Our store is located in the heart of Wicker Park at 1272 N. Milwaukee in Chicago, Illinois. We are conveniently located by the CTA Division Blue Line stop as well as the Ashland, Milwaukee, and Division bus routes. We also have the privilege of sharing the neighborhood with fellow vinyl sellers Dusty Grooves and Reckless Records, making our block the best record shopping area in the city. 

We carry all genres of of music new and old and curate a selection of releases from local Chicago & Minneapolis artists, with an emphasis on obscure, rare, or hard to find titles. Our New-Vinyl stock is extremely diverse, from chart-toppers like Taylor Swift, Sia, and Sam Smith to drone-metal heavyweights like Sunn, Boris, and Sleep. Customers can browse this selection in-store via designated iPads and may also choose in-store pick up for items they buy online at home. ### Syntrend Vinyl (三創黑膠)

No. 2, Section 3, Civic Blvd, Zhongshan District, Taipei City, 104

Boasting of more than 20,000 records in its combined sales floor and warehouse spaces, this waxy hotspot, housed inside the newly-established Syntrend Creative Park, is a connoisseurs’ paradise. As one of Taipei’s biggest record collections, Syntrend Vinyl puts an emphasis on classical classics – though old jazz and pop favorites are not entirely dismissed either. More fascinating than the sheer volume of records is the curios on display: limited edition sonatas on wax locked firmly behind glass cabinets, some of which valued at more than NT$80,000, will easily break collectors’ hearts or bank accounts. True audiophiles may rejoice; Syntrend Vinyl is aptly situated near major audio gadget go-tos like Harman/Kardon, so you can pick up all the essentials in one quick go.

### Aads Platenzaak

Korvelseweg 208, Tilburg, Nederland.

In 1988 is Aads Platenzaak begonnen in een piepklein winkeltje op het St.-Annaplein in Tilburg. Begonnen als een hobby met het opkopen van collecties via snuffelkrantjes, groeide Aads Platenzaak uit tot een fenomeen onder Tilburgse platenkopers. 

Toen het winkeltje te klein werd, verhuisde Aad in 1990 naar de Telefoonstraat. Midden en eind jaren '90 beleefde Aad gouden tijden, toen de cd-verkoop op zijn piek was. Na krap twintig jaar vertrok Aad in het voorjaar van 2009 uit het centrum van Tilburg naar de huidige locatie van de winkel: Korvelseweg 208. 

Bij Aads Platenzaak vind je heel veel LP's, cd's en vinyl singles.

![Aads Platenzaak](https://discogslabs.imgix.net/vinylhub/552fcb20da69a80011c4e7ee.jpg?auto=compress%2Cformat&fit=max&fm=jpg&h=2000&w=2000&s=8d8b685cd4455fe1ae3b7874ebac3170 "Aads Platenzaak")

### Lotus Record Shop

7 Skra Street Thessaloniki

Lotus Record Shop is located in Thessaloniki; having first opened in December 1990, it remains up to date a standard reference point to local music enthusiasts.

Specialising in certain styles, yet covering a broad range of genres, our mission is to support several aspects of the underground music industry. Through CD and vinyl imports from various places across the globe, Lotus aims to portray a clear picture of the most interesting records. Despite the fragmentation and saturation caused both by the immense production of music and the speed of information exchange, the Lotus team carefully selects and suggests the most eclectic sounds from each music genre.

We believe that music is a living organism under constant development, and thus endeavour towards tracing its coordinates and latest trends.

We have also allocated a part of our website on local (Greek) independent labels, as a means to supporting the local music scene. We trust that this virtual 'topos' will aid the distribution of the products of the labels supported.

Lotus primarily remains a physical record shop. Should you visit our hometown, do not hesitate dropping by our offices - we'd be glad to see you.

![Lotus Record Shop](https://discogslabs.imgix.net/vinylhub/539a98a116672c00089788d1.jpg?auto=compress%2Cformat&fit=max&fm=jpg&h=2000&w=2000&s=e9aa6750772a2e4ece4392359a38daf5 "Lotus Record Shop")

### Vinyl-a-Gogo

Krossener Str.24
10245 Berlin
Germany

Step into the Wonderful World of the Vinyl-a-GoGo Cosmos. You are a Digger, Treasurehunter, Beginner or a Knowitall-Guy, a Walking Encyclopedia, Mint only Perfectionist, have you got a Singles-Fetish? Version-Collector, Traditionalist, Hipster or just Music Lover? Do you need my hand and some help? Well I hope to satisfy all your wishes. And if you don't find it right now I will try to organize it. My own music spectrum is wide open. I try to offer all different styles of music. In case today only Dub or Hip Hop tunes are on the turntable it's just an accident most probably some weird Jazz is going to run in repeat mode tomorrow or some African Funk or my beloved Tindersticks or I am trying to make a winters sleep and go for Max Richter or some of the great greater greatest Steve Reich works. Beside that you'll often hear some old Sixtie s Mod & Beathymns or some Soulshaker here. Twangy Guitars, why not? Some Doo Woppin' lovesongs there and then, great!

Whertukkie would we be today without Morricones arrangements? Organs? Yeah baby, please. French or Italian cheesy Pop? Ooh my God, please bring it on! France Gall (the young France Gall) please would you marry me? The best ever ever ever ever made Album in the world? "Pornography" no discussions please although "Postcards from L.A." is also one of the most fantastic Albums in the world. What more wisdoms there are to be discussed ...Mod or Teddy? AC/DC only with Bon Scott or nowadays with Axl Rose? Oasis or Blur? (Suede is the correct answer!) East 17 or NKOTB? Yep, that once was a question. Was Michael King of Pop really murdered? Are 2Pac & Biggie together on their little island laughing about us all? Motown or Stax? Is the spoken word the future of the music? (Word up!). Have you been marking your handwrists with XXX is when you were young too? Is the German Krautrock and Avantgarde overrated? Beatles or Stones? (Beatles when they were young and playing RnR, Stones for still-being-around ... but I could live without both of them.) My own best dig ever? The Can's Original Monster Movie on Music Factory. Ever seen THE perfect collection ... not yet. My best selling album of all times? The Darkside of the Moon. One Album I hate myself for selling once? An Original Ebo Taylor Funk Classic on Essiebons Label from Ghana. Yes, Otis Redding was dying way too early. No, Elvis didn t invent RnR. Jimi Hendrix was and will be King of the Guitar forever. Blue Note is the most collected jazzlabel but Prestige still has the prettier Label and for me Impulse the nicer Artwork. Yaya, so many wisdoms ... King Tubby or Prince Jammy or still Perry (Jah Shaka is here the correct answer)? Why does everybody love Bob Marley? Do Russians still listen to Modern Talking? When will the Chinese start to become serious Record buyers and collectors? Early Screwdriver stuff is political correct? Is Black Metal as black as they say? Why is all the world collecting this boring Vertigo Swirl Records? Who is buying all this cheap Bootlegs and overpriced Re-Issues instead of lovely old Pressings? Dylan or Young? What about the Rodriguez Hype? Real DJs only use 7 Inch? What else...well well well so many essential and existential questions about music ... come and find out your own answers at Vinyl-a-GoGo, Krossener Str.24 at the Boxhagener Platz, Berlin. And if you catch me in the right mood there s a good coffee on the house and I am going to play some of my beloved weird German Cheesy Cover Versions. Strictly on 7 Inch ...what else!

FOR SALE IN THE SHOP:
99 % strictly Vinyl. 7 Inch, 10 Inch, 12 Inch Maxis, LPs, Boxsets some 78 rpm shellac.

Few CD offers for 3 Euro each and some Rockclassics, Blues, Soul, Jazz, Hardcore and Emocore CDs are available. Some Tapes for children are available too.

Online:
For my Online sales I am using the platform www.discogs.com with my very own sellers name Vinyl-a-GoGo. There I have actually listed more than 3.500 Vinyls and few CDs of all kinds. I have received more than 2000 positive feedbacks already and take this job very serious. All listed offers are stocked separately. You can come to my shop address to pick them up right there without booking them in advance. A short notice before helps to organize everything.

At the shop you will find more than 15.000 LPs and Singles for sale.

Musikgenres at the shop:
Reggae and Dub with all of its faces. More than 1000 LPs und Maxis. 4 boxes full of 7 Inches with lovely Bamboo Singles, Studio 1 Pressings, Twinkle Labels, Reggae on Top etc etc. Ska and Rocksteady, Soca and Calypso, Dancehall and Raggamuffin, Roots Reggae, Spoken Word Poets. Very large Lee Scratch Perry Collection. Many Original Pressings from UK and Jamaica. Labels: On-U Sound, Greensleeves, Prince Buster, Coxsone, Studio 1, Trojan, Tuff Gong or Upsetters.

Hip Hop: German Rap, French Hip Hop, Britcore, Gangster Rap, Westcoast and Eastcoast, Electro and Battle Breaks, Oldschool, Sugarhill Records. Maxi 12 Inch selection.

Beats and elektronic music: small but sexy. No actual Dance Charts. Alltime Classics and a focus on Albums. Labels: Rephlex, Tresor, Ninja Tunes, Gigolo, Disco B, Soma etc. Disco Maxi selection with Italo Disco, Disco Funk, Hiphouse, Rave. Plus some weird Russian pressings from the Sealt Label.

Worldmusic: One of my personal favourites. Large Africa Collection. East African Jazz Tunes, traditional stuff from different nations and tribes to Highlife and AfroBeat from Western Africa.

France: Chansons to YeYe Girls. France Gall and Sheila, Dutronc, Ferrer and Gainsbourg to George Brassens, Johnny Hallyday, Edith Piaf, Dassin or Becaud. Plus Mano Negra, DJ Cam or Daft Punk and Air.

Italia: Songwriter, Italo Progrock, Pop and Italo Disco. Lucio Battisti, Milva, Rita Pavone, Gianni Morandi, Adriano Celentano, Gianna Nanini and Eros Ramazotti.

East Europe: a lot of Polish Jazz and Progrock. Some Czech Beat records and rare sounds from Armenia and Georgia to Mongolia, Russia and Ukraine.

Molam from Thailand. Phillippines, Asia and Indonesia with many exotic tunes.

Tablas and Sitars from India and Pakistan. More than Ravi Shankar only.

Recently I have got a large selection of old records from Libanon, Egypt, Iran and Turkey.

Spanish Beat, Pop and Flamenco.

All kinds of Latinamerican Rhythms. Cuban Salsa and Merengue to Cumbia, Pachanga and Cha Cha Cha.

Bossa Nova, Samba and Batucada from Brazil.

Jazz: Swing, Bop, Cool, Free and Avant Jazz. Labels: MPS, Verve, Prestige, Atlantic, ECM/Enya, Impulse, Emcry, BASF, Saba, Amiga und Osteuropa.
Lovely Blue Note Collection with some highly wanted Originals from the1500 and 4000 series.

Large assortment of importand artists like Keith Jarrett, Django Reinhardt, Miles Davis, Thelonious Monk or John Coltrane.

Blues, Soul and Funk: Very nice stuff from Labels like Arhoolie, King, Atlantic, Stax and Motown. P Funk, Disco, Electric Blues etc.

Singer and Songwriter, Folk. All the known big names like Joan Baez, Tim Buckley, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Bob Dylan, Nick Drake, Leonard Cohen, Bruce Springsteen, Tom Waits or Neil Young.

Rock'n'Roll, Surf, Country and Rockabilly. Garage and Psychobilly.

60's and 70's Rock, Pop, Beat, Psychedelic, Glamrock, Progressive Rock, Deutsche Schlager. From 13th Floor Elevators to Frank Zappa. Islands, Bronze, Vertigo Swirl, Liberty ... all the big company labels from the glory rockages. Abba, Beatles, Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd, Deep Purple, Janis Joplin, Kinks, Them, Jethro Tull, Queen, Slade, the WHO, Jimi Hendrix, Velvet Underground and Lou Reed Solo, CCR, the Stooges and Iggy Pop Solo, Animals, Brainticket, T Rex etc etc.

80's, 90's until today. Pop, Wave, EBM and Industrial, Gothic, New Romance, Minimal Synth, Neo Psyche and Garage, Avantgarde, Indie Rock, Grunge and Alternative. Nirvana, Talking Heads, Talk Talk, the Smiths, the Cure, Depeche Mode, Nick Cave, Tindersticks, Blondie, Kate Bush, Residents, Pixies, Sisters of Mercy, Siouxsie and the Banshees, Oasis, Blur, Pearl Jam, Radiohead, Pavement, U 2, R.E.M.,Wipers, Wire, New Order and Joy Division, Gun Club, Au Pairs, Durutti Column, Deine Lakaien, Pere Ubu, the Fall, Ween, Coil, Throbbing Gristle, SPK, Björk, B-52's or several different John Peel Sessions.

Extra sections with Picture Discs, Autographed Vinyls, 10 Inches, old Shellacs or Boxsets.

Friends of loud and fast musick will find a lot of Punk, Oi, Hardrock, Heavy Metal, Emo and Hardcore, Power Metal, Grindcore, Death Metal, Black Metal or Speed Metal. NWOBHM.

Krautrock, Deutsche Avantgarde and early Electronic Pioneers, German Protest Rock from East and West e.g.: The Can, Neu!, Amon Düül, Nektar, Kraftwerk, Popol Vuh, Gomorrha, Eloy, Embryo, Tangerine Dream, Conrad Schnitzler, Ton Steine Scherben, Goldene Zitronen, Foyer des Arts, der Plan, Andreas Dorau, Tocotronic, Rammstein, die Sterne, Sandow, Feeling B, die Skeptiker, Slime, Abwärts, die Toten Hosen, die Ärzte, DAF, Fehlfarben, Einstürzende Neubauten ...Labels as Green Brain, Spiegelei, Brutkasten, No Fun, Schneeball, Vertigo Swirl or diverse Private Pressings are stocked too..

A lot of former East German Music History. Labels: Amiga, Eterna, Schola, Nova and Litera.

A small Berlin section with some artists from Berlin or live recordings in Berlin are added here.

Friends of classic and avantgardistic sounds can choose between Stockhausen, John Cage, Phillip Glass, Steve Reich, Berio, Schönberg, Berg or nice Deutsche Grammophon pressings.

Original Soundscores I love to offer too. Goblin or Morricone to James Horner and Hans Zimmer. Western, Science Fiction, Horror, Blaxploitation, James Bond. Especially within the singles selection you can find a lot of weird and exotic sounds and evergreens.

One subcategory I love the most is the Cover Version section. A lot of cheesy (mainly) German Versions but some French and Italian ones too that can make your ears get bloody.

### Chez Emile Records

Located in the centre of the French city of Lyon, the record shop Chez Emile will offer you a very special digging session. 

Street to meet Emile’s electronic vinyl selection.

Sit comfortably wait for a coffee and let Emile introduce you to the newest vinyl he selected for you, you will feel “just like home”.

As an attentive host proud of his hometown Emile offers you a selection of the best artists from the local scene but also new and second-hand vinyl from all over the world.

Specialized in house and techno music you will find a broad selection of all the genres resulting from this culture. Emile will surprise you by his choices that go from the newest experimental discovery to the classical origins of electronic music such as jazz, soul or disco records.

### Bij Klaas

De Heurne 39
Enschede

Opened in 2015, Bij Klaas has a shop full of mostly new CDs and DVDs which he is buying in bulk lots. There also is a big row of 2nd vinyl, all priced 10 EUR (albums) 5 EUR (12inches & classical music) 1,50 EUR (7inches). Bands with familiair names are often priced higher, but you can find real bargains for 10 EUR as the owners have no clue of the prices of records.

### Underground Solu'shn

9 Cockburn Street,
Old Town,
Edinburgh,
Midlothian,
EH1 1BP
Scotland
United Kingdom

Music specialist & audio emporium with 1000s of vinyl records, CDs, and audio products, plus a comprehensive selection of sound equipment and DJ technology.

The sole surviving independent Dance, Electronic, and specialist record shop in Edinburgh, selling quality music and audio equipment in Scotland’s capital since 1995.

Starting in a dingy Old Town basement on Cockburn Street before relocating to overground premises further down the same street, they began as an ‘underground’ record shop selling House, Techno, Disco, Hip Hop, Funk, Soul, Jazz, and Drum & Bass on their preferred vinyl medium. To this day they still support the format which kicked it all off, stocking hundreds of new releases every week, though embracing any new technology which makes the enjoyment of music possible. They've also expanded the range of music they sell, to incorporate Classic Rock, Pop and current indie releases.

You’ll find their shelves groaning with the latest DJ and music production equipment including turntables, mixers, CD decks, midi controllers, computer DJ systems, software, speakers, and headphones from all the top brands such as Pioneer, Novation, Allen & Heath, Focusrite, Rane, Native Instruments, Korg, Akai, Reloop, Sennheiser, Stanton, Numark, M-Audio, Ortofon and Pro-ject.

There are stacks of wax to wade into, and countless CDs to get your ears around, but also a wide range of accessories including cartridges & stylus, vinyl/equipment cases/bags, T-shirts, and numerous books and magazines.

![Underground Solu'shn](https://discogslabs.imgix.net/vinylhub/56a94cb6f980c4001b4540cd.jpg?auto=compress%2Cformat&fit=max&fm=jpg&h=2000&w=2000&s=c61359913ddbefa8d3572926d5822c5f "Underground Solu'shn")
